Introduction
Overview :
Mechanical Engineering at Pillai College of Engineering (PCE) stands as a cornerstone of engineering excellence in Navi Mumbai. The department, established with a vision to nurture innovative engineers, offers a comprehensive four-year B.Tech program that combines theoretical knowledge with practical applications. As one of the best mechanical engineering colleges in Navi Mumbai, PCE’s program is designed to meet the evolving demands of the industry while maintaining academic rigor, innovation, and a commitment to developing future-ready engineers.
Program Outcomes:
PO1: Engineering Knowledge: Apply knowledge of mathematics, natural science, computing, engineering fundamentals and an engineering specialization as specified in WK1 to WK4 respectively to develop to the solution of complex engineering problems.
PO2: Problem Analysis: Identify, formulate, review research literature and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions with consideration for sustainable development. (WK1 to WK4)
PO3: Design/Development of Solutions: Design creative solutions for complex engineering problems and design/develop systems/components/processes to meet identified needs with consideration for the public health and safety, whole-life cost,net zero carbon, culture, society and environment as required. (WK5)
PO4: Conduct Investigations of Complex Problems: Conduct investigations of complex engineering problems using research-based knowledge including design of experiments, modelling, analysis & interpretation of data to provide valid conclusions. (WK8).
PO5: Engineering Tool Usage: Create, select and apply appropriate techniques, resources and modern engineering & IT tools, including prediction and modelling recognizing their limitations to solve complex engineering problems. (WK2 and WK6)
PO6: The Engineer and The World: Analyze and evaluate societal and environmental aspects while solving complex engineering problems for its impact on sustainability with reference to economy, health, safety, legal framework, culture and environment. (WK1, WK5, and WK7).
PO7: Ethics: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics, human values, diversity and inclusion; adhere to national & international laws. (WK9).
PO8: Individual and Collaborative Team work: Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse/multi-disciplinary teams.
PO9: Communication: Communicate effectively and inclusively within the engineering community and society at large, such as being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations considering cultural, language, and learning differences
PO10: Project Management and Finance: Apply knowledge and understanding of engineering management principles and economic decision-making and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, and to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.
PO11: Life-Long Learning: Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability for
independent and life-long learning
adaptability to new and emerging technologies and
critical thinking in the broadest context of technological change. (WK8)
Program Educational Objectives:
To prepare students for successful careers in industry to meet the needs of Indian and Global companies.
To develop the ability among students to synthesize data, interpret them appropriately and be able to apply concepts to mechanical system design or to a mechanical subsystem of an interdisciplinary system.
To provide opportunity for students to work in their individual capacity as well as to function as teams on multidisciplinary projects.
To enable students for lifelong learning and introduce them to professional ethics and sustainable development.
To develop among students an attitude towards self-employment through entrepreneurship.
Program Specific Outcomes:
Students should be able to generate and develop ideas that can result in self- employment (eg.Start-ups) and also result in creation of more jobs for the society.
Students should be able to model and develop solutions for problems relevant to industry and the society at large.
Mechanical Engineering

Mechanical Engineering encompasses the design, manufacturing, and maintenance of mechanical systems. At PCE, the program covers core areas including:

These technocrats should be able to apply basic and contemporary science, engineering and research skills to identify problems in the industry and academia and be able to develop practical solutions to them.

Admission Process
Admission Requirements
To apply for the Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering at Pillai College of Engineering, students must meet specific academic qualifications and submit the required documentation.
Educational Qualifications:
Candidates must have passed the HSC (Higher Secondary Certificate) examination or an equivalent qualification.
Physics and Mathematics are compulsory subjects.
In addition to Physics and Mathematics, candidates must have one of the following subjects:
Chemistry
Biotechnology
Biology
Technical Vocational subjects
Minimum Marks Requirement:
Candidates must have obtained at least 45% marks in the qualifying examination.
For students from backward class categories, Economically Weaker Sections, and Persons with Disability from Maharashtra, the minimum requirement is 40% marks.
Entrance Examination:
Applicants must have appeared for either the MHT-CET (Maharashtra Common Entrance Test) or JEE Main.
A non-zero score in one of these examinations is mandatory.
Diploma Holders:
Candidates with a Diploma in Engineering and Technology are also eligible for admission.
They must have secured at least 45% marks (40% for certain backward class categories) in their diploma program.
Note:
The cutoff for Mechanical Engineering 2024-25 at Pillai College was 61.635 percentile.

Application Timeline
The admission process for Mechanical Engineering at Pillai College of Engineering typically follows the MHT-CET and JEE Main merit system.
Here are the general key application milestones:
Key Application Milestones:
MHT-CET Registration: Generally opens in early January.
MHT-CET Exam Date: Usually held in May.
CAP Rounds: Commence after the exam results, typically in June-July.
Admission Deadlines: Vary based on the schedules for CAP rounds and JEE Main results.
Important Notes:
It is essential for prospective students to stay updated on application openings, CAP round deadlines, and document verification periods each year.
Meeting the eligibility criteria will help ensure a smooth admission process.
To stay informed about specific dates, students should regularly check the official MHT-CET website.
By keeping track of these important dates and requirements, students can effectively navigate their journey to admission at Pillai College of Engineering.
Mechanical Engineering Exams
Overview of Relevant Exams
To pursue a Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering at Pillai College of Engineering, students must qualify through competitive entrance exams.
The primary exam for admission is the MHT-CET (Maharashtra Common Entrance Test), conducted by the State Common Entrance Test Cell, Maharashtra. This exam evaluates candidates on essential subjects such as Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry/Biology, with a non-zero score required for eligibility.
Alternatively, students can also apply through the JEE Main exam, a national-level assessment recognized for admissions to engineering programs across India. Both MHT-CET and JEE Main scores play a significant role in securing admission to top engineering colleges, including Pillai College of Engineering.
By excelling in entrance exams like MHT-CET or JEE Main, aspiring engineers can embark on their educational journey at Pillai College of Engineering, setting themselves up for a rewarding future in mechanical engineering.
Exam Preparation Resources
Preparing for entrance exams like MHT-CET and JEE Main is crucial for aspiring students looking to secure a spot at Pillai College of Engineering, one of the leading colleges for mechanical engineering in Navi Mumbai. Here are some recommended study materials and strategies to help you excel:
Recommended Study Materials:
Textbooks: Focus on NCERT textbooks for Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry, as they cover fundamental concepts that are essential for both MHT-CET and JEE Main.
Reference Books:
Physics: “Concepts of Physics” by H.C. Verma
Mathematics: “Objective Mathematics” by R.D. Sharma
Chemistry: “Organic Chemistry” by Morrison and Boyd
Online Resources: Websites like Khan Academy, BYJU’S, and Unacademy offer video lectures and practice problems specifically tailored for these entrance exams.
Previous Year Papers: Solve previous years’ question papers for MHT-CET and JEE Main to understand the exam pattern and frequently asked questions.
Mock Tests: Regularly take mock tests to build your exam temperament and time management skills. Many coaching centers and online platforms provide simulated exam environments.
Note: For practicing you can visit:
mockcet.mes.ac.in
Study Strategies:
Create a Study Schedule: Allocate specific time blocks for each subject and stick to your schedule. Regular revisions are key to retaining information.
Focus on Weak Areas: Identify your weak points in each subject and dedicate extra time to improve those areas.
Group Study: Collaborate with peers preparing for the same exams to share resources and solve problems together. This can enhance understanding and make studying more engaging.
Stay Updated: Follow announcements related to the exams and admission process to ensure you don’t miss any important information.
By utilizing these resources and strategies, students can enhance their chances of success in the entrance exams and secure their place at Pillai College of Engineering. Excelling in these exams is not just about hard work; it’s also about strategic preparation that aligns with the requirements of one of the top colleges for mechanical engineering in Navi Mumbai.
Note:
For practicing you can visit:

Frequently Asked Questions
What is the scope of mechanical engineering in India?
Mechanical engineering in India
offers a vast array of career opportunities across sectors like automotive, aerospace, energy, robotics, manufacturing, and infrastructure. As one of the oldest and most versatile branches, mechanical engineering remains essential in fields where machinery, energy, and design intersect. Graduates find roles in multinational companies, government agencies, and private firms with starting packages averaging around 4-6 LPA.
Why choose Pillai College of Engineering (PCE) for mechanical engineering?
PCE is among the
best mechanical engineering colleges in Mumbai
, with a program that emphasizes hands-on learning, modern facilities, and experienced faculty. The department is NAAC ‘A’ accredited and offers specialized laboratories for CAD/CAM, robotics, thermal engineering, and more, preparing students for high-demand roles in
mechanical engineers in India
and abroad. PCE’s strong industry partnerships also enable valuable internship and placement opportunities, with an impressive 85% placement record
What is the eligibility criteria for the mechanical engineering course at PCE?
To apply for the
engineering degree courses in India
at PCE, prospective students need to have completed their 10+2 education with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics (PCM) as core subjects. A valid score in either JEE or MHT-CET is required, with admission based on merit through a transparent process. Specific cutoffs vary annually, and students are encouraged to apply early.
How is the mechanical engineering curriculum structured?
The
mechanical engineering course
at PCE is structured to provide a balance between foundational knowledge and emerging technology. Core subjects include Thermodynamics, Design Engineering, and Manufacturing Processes, alongside advanced courses in Industry 4.0, Robotics, and Automation. Elective courses and a final-year project enable students to specialize in areas of interest.
What industry connections does the mechanical engineering department have?
PCE has partnerships with several leading industry players, ensuring students have access to real-world applications and internship opportunities. Collaborations with companies such as Tata Motors, L&T, and Mahindra & Mahindra give students hands-on exposure and strengthen their employability.
What research opportunities are available for mechanical engineering students?
Research is a key focus at PCE. The
mechanical engineering department
conducts industry-sponsored and government-funded research projects in areas like sustainable energy, materials engineering, and automation. Students can participate in these projects and gain practical experience in cutting-edge fields. Research publications and patent opportunities also allow students to build a strong research profile.
The Faculty of the Department of Mechanical Engineering are experts in numerous disciplines and are involved in following research areas:
Renewable Energy
Refrigeration and Air Conditioning
Advanced Heat Transfer
Computer Aided Manufacturing
Mechatronics & Robotics
Advanced Manufacturing
Computational Fluid Dynamics
Are there any student clubs or associations for mechanical engineering students?
Yes, PCE hosts the
Mechanical Engineering Students Association (MESA)
, where students can network, participate in workshops, and collaborate on technical projects. This association organizes events, competitions, and technical talks, fostering a sense of community and encouraging professional development among students.
What is the placement record for mechanical engineering graduates at PCE?
PCE has an outstanding 85% placement record, with graduates securing positions in top companies such as Tata Motors, Godrej, and L&T. The average starting package for
mechanical engineers
is around 5-7 LPA, with opportunities to grow further. The department’s placement cell actively connects students with employers through campus placements and job fairs.
What facilities are available for mechanical engineering students?
The
mechanical engineering department
at PCE offers a suite of advanced laboratories and workshop facilities, including a CAD/CAM lab, thermal engineering lab, and a robotics and automation lab. The computer simulation center further allows students to experiment with virtual modeling and simulation, ensuring practical learning in line with industry standards.
Does the college offer a mechanical engineering diploma?
Currently, PCE offers only the full
B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering
program. Diploma holders looking to advance their education in mechanical engineering may apply for lateral entry, allowing them to enter the B.Tech program directly.
What are the career prospects for mechanical engineering graduates?
Mechanical engineering graduates from PCE are prepared for a range of career paths. Roles in design, quality control, and project management are common in sectors like automotive, aerospace, energy, and manufacturing. Graduates also find positions in automation and robotics, reflecting the growing importance of
Industry 4.0 technologies
in engineering.
How can students apply for the mechanical engineering course?
Students interested in the
mechanical engineering course
at PCE can apply online through the college’s official website. The application process includes completing the online form, submitting required documents, and participating in counseling rounds based on merit scores in JEE/MHT-CET.
What extracurricular activities are available to mechanical engineering students?
PCE encourages students to engage in various extracurricular activities to develop both technical and soft skills. The Mechanical Engineering Students Association (MESA) organizes workshops, industry visits, and national-level competitions, while guest lectures from industry experts provide additional learning opportunities.
Does PCE offer internships for mechanical engineering students?
Yes, PCE mandates internships as part of the
mechanical engineering course
, with opportunities facilitated through the department’s strong industry connections. Internships allow students to work directly with companies, gaining hands-on experience and a practical understanding of engineering principles.
What scholarships are available for mechanical engineering students?
PCE offers a range of scholarships to support students in their pursuit of an
engineering degree
. Scholarships are awarded based on merit, financial need, and academic performance, helping students cover tuition costs and other expenses.
Does PCE provide international exposure for mechanical engineering students?
PCE has established collaborations with international academic institutions and professional organizations, providing students with opportunities to participate in exchange programs, internships abroad, and collaborative research. Such exposure gives students a global perspective and makes them more competitive in the international job market.
What support services are available to mechanical engineering students?
PCE provides several support services to ensure student success, including academic counseling, a dedicated placement cell, and a mentorship program. The library, with its extensive collection of engineering books and journals, and online resources, further aids students in their academic pursuits.
Can students specialize within the mechanical engineering program?
While PCE offers a general
B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering
, students can choose elective courses and focus on areas like robotics, thermal engineering, and Industry 4.0. Additionally, the final-year project allows students to delve deeper into a specific area of interest, which helps with specialization.
What opportunities are there for mechanical engineering graduates to pursue higher studies?
Graduates from PCE are well-prepared for higher studies in mechanical engineering and related fields. Many alumni choose to pursue M.Tech, MBA, or Ph.D. programs, both in India and internationally, further expanding their career prospects and potential for leadership roles.
Does PCE offer career counseling and placement support for mechanical engineering students?
Yes, PCE has a dedicated placement cell that works closely with the
mechanical engineering department
to support students in securing jobs post-graduation. Career counseling sessions help students identify their strengths and interests, and placement drives connect students with recruiters from top companies.
